mayphus.title: Mayphus
mayphus.description: A dad, a maker, a perpetual learner

heroIntro: Hi, I'm Mayphus – a maker driven by curiosity who finds the most interesting discoveries at the edges where different worlds collide.

I'm fascinated by the irreplaceable human elements: the spark of a new idea, the intuition that connects seemingly unrelated concepts, and the persistence to iterate until something beautiful emerges. My workshop reflects this approach – it's a space where digital fabrication meets traditional craftsmanship, where engineering precision embraces creative experimentation.
I think across boundaries, see patterns others miss, and understand that true innovation comes not from mastering a single domain, but from weaving together insights from many.

tangmeifa.title: Tang Mei Fa
tangmeifa.description: Learning, culture, and story-driven Mandarin lessons

heroIntro: 你好，我是唐美發 – I share Mandarin through stories that connect language with everyday life.
Lessons blend culture, personal narratives, and practical vocabulary so learners stay motivated beyond textbooks.
TangMeiFa.com curates workshops, study guides, and multimedia practice for curious minds.

connect.lead: Have questions about upcoming lessons? Reach me at {email} or follow the latest updates.

zhengsanniu.title: Zheng Sanniu Studio
zhengsanniu.description: Handcrafted prototypes that blend hardware sketches with poetic software

heroIntro: 你好，我是郑三牛 – I document the sketches, circuits, and poems that guide each prototype.
My studio is equal parts solder smoke and narrative voice. Each build log shows the why behind the wiring.
If you enjoy tangible storytelling and gentle technology, you will feel at home here.

tangqiao.title: Tang Qiao Foundation
tangqiao.description: Community-led learning circles for makers, gardeners, and storytellers

heroIntro: Tang Qiao nurtures small, resilient communities around food, fabrication, and folklore.
We host learning circles where neighbors trade craft skills, swap seeds, and archive personal histories.
The projects captured here are living invitations—join a workshop, share a recipe, or start a new circle.
